Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (89.47%) tosynthetic N-[RLLR]2-CR: 24%; L: 29%; K: 18%.  GRAVY: -0.735; M Wt: 2077.655; Mol formula: C92H173N33O19S1; molar extinction coeff: 0.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 4 ug/ml), P. putida (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. enteritidis (MIC 1 ug/ml), Gram+  B. subtilis (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. mutans (MIC 2 ug/ml), fungi C. neoformans (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. cerevisiae (MIC 1 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 1 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: MIC increased substantially 32-64 ug/ml in the presence of 200 mM NaCL: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli; NaCl-sensitive:P. putida; NaCl-sensitive:S. enteritidis; NaCl-sensitive: B. subtilis; NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus; NaCl-sensitive:S. mutans; NaCl-sensitive:C. neoformans; NaCl-sensitive:S. cerevisiae;  NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans. Literature Information.Author: Park IY, Cho JH, Kim KS, Kim YB, Kim MS, Kim SC. 2004
Literature Information.Title: Helix stability confers salt resistance upon helical antimicrobial peptides.
